intro: Hulsea brevifolia, commonly known as the shortleaf hulsea, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Cistaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine, white hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often blooming in early spring. Hulsea brevifolia thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks.
